On 4/27/2018 at 1:27 AM, N70 said:

That was a PR build, try https://jenkins.spaceball.cf/job/Kerbalism/104/artifact/Kerbalism.zip

Just tried it out. Still the same...

Maybe there's a conflict with some other mod? A have a couple of them:

Does anyone observe the same weird behavior? My Kerbalism windows don't show up, and trying to open any window breaks the mouse wheel zooming.

1 hour ago, dymanoid said:

Just tried it out. Still the same...

Maybe there's a conflict with some other mod? A have a couple of them:

Have you tried removing half the couple of them and seeing if the issue remains?  What about the other half?  That's a lot to troubleshoot.  If the issue continues try to halve them again, and again until you find out if there is a conflict.

Peace.

Yes, already in progress.

Deleting all the mods and running with Kerbalism only helped. So there's something not compatible with Kerbalism, or Kerbalism is not compatible with something.

That's really strange - no related errors in the log file.

On 4/27/2018 at 3:04 AM, dymanoid said:

I have the same issues some other users posted above even with this build: the Kerbalism windows don't show up (e.g. Data or Configure Pod, the list of vessels etc.), and zooming with the mouse wheel stops working after trying to open a Kerbalism window.

I had this problem. The reason was in Community Resource Pack. Seriously. CRP was overwritten. Try to reinstall it.
New repo is on github! https://github.com/MoreRobustThanYou/Kerbalism

Sorry if this is a stupid question, but I use CKAN. How do I install this update via CKAN? Is it updated automatically on space dock?

Edited May 2, 2018 by thechief18

On 5/2/2018 at 4:01 AM, dymanoid said:

Yes, already in progress.

Deleting all the mods and running with Kerbalism only helped. So there's something not compatible with Kerbalism, or Kerbalism is not compatible with something.

That's really strange - no related errors in the log file.

You could try adding them back one by one making sure that they are all the latest. Then you'll find the culprit(s)

2 hours ago, N70 said:

New repo is on github! https://github.com/MoreRobustThanYou/Kerbalism

For what reason if I may ask? And will it get a jenkins instance associated with it?
I love Kerbalism especially how it handles science and data transmission. Is there a way to switch off the part failure feature of this mod?

3 hours ago, Someone2018 said:

For what reason if I may ask? And will it get a jenkins instance associated with it?

I got unflagged from github. And I already hooked it up to Jenkins. Consider the Gitlab deprecated.

Thought sspx had not been/still isn't supported? Was there supposed to be support for it in the latest build?

Just now, Zeroroller said:

Thought sspx had not been/still isn't supported? Was there supposed to be support for it in the latest build?

Could be, but this is an MM syntax error...

So basically it doesn't have anything to do with SSPX-compatiblity yes or no.

Quick bug report in 1.4.2 none of the info panels work in flight.

Please let me know if there is a better place to put this.

Edited May 3, 2018 by SpaceN00b
Never mind read the pages before this post.

3 hours ago, Corbzila said:

I love Kerbalism especially how it handles science and data transmission. Is there a way to switch off the part failure feature of this mod? 

In the settings.cfg of kerbalism, try setting reliability = false.
1.5.1 will be here soon.

1.5.1 is out now! https://spacedock.info/mod/1774/Kerbalism/download/1.5.1

 

Changelog:

  • SSPX support

  • Adds a version of the Water Electrolysis process that doesn't dump excess Oxygen

  • Added huge 3.5m containers

  • German/Russian Localization (thank you Riggers and player101!)

  • Probably some other stuff I forgot

Report any bugs you find!

Edited May 3, 2018 by N70

21 hours ago, N70 said:

New repo is on github! https://github.com/MoreRobustThanYou/Kerbalism

That's more like it

On 4/29/2018 at 10:03 AM, Rudolf Meier said:

then labs in Kerbin orbit are useless... returning the samples is much easier

A page late to the conversation, but my approach is using Kerbalism science to analyze samples remotely, plus MKS which gives a trickle of science just for having scientists in a "kolony" (which can be a station or ship), somewhat abstracting the near-infinite variety of small experiments a scientist can do in an orbital lab.

@N70 when something happens, like no more EC, the out-of-timewarp is too hard, that creates issues like borked orbits or bent nodes... so a more slightly and smooth slowdown is also needed here.

At least for the part before physics kick in.

Hi all! 

I've just released the third beta of my Simplex profile on Spacedock.  Let me know what you think!

https://spacedock.info/mod/1344

forum link

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/159470-wip-anglecan-simplex-08/

Peace.

@evilman222 Not quite MKS yet but support for USI Reactors, Kontainers and FTT is now included with Kerbalism, you can try with the latest Jenkins build before the release comes out.

If you try it can you let me know what you think

https://jenkins.spaceball.cf/job/Kerbalism/138/artifact/Kerbalism.zip
